name: Isaiah 19:13
text: The princes of Zoan have become fools. The princes of Memphis are deceived. They have caused Egypt to go astray, who are the cornerstone of her tribes.

name: Isaiah 19:14
text: Yahweh has mixed a spirit of perverseness in the midst of her; and they have caused Egypt to go astray in all of its works, like a drunken man staggers in his vomit.

name: Isaiah 19:15
text: Neither shall there be any work for Egypt, which head or tail, palm branch or rush, may do.

name: Isaiah 19:16
text: In that day the Egyptians will be like women. They will tremble and fear because of the shaking of the hand of Yahweh of Armies, which he shakes over them.

name: Isaiah 19:17
text: The land of Judah will become a terror to Egypt. Everyone to whom mention is made of it will be afraid, because of the plans of Yahweh of Armies, which he determines against it.

name: Isaiah 19:18
text: In that day, there will be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan, and swear to Yahweh of Armies. One will be called "The city of destruction."

name: Isaiah 19:19
text: In that day, there will be an altar to Yahweh in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to Yahweh at its border.

name: Isaiah 19:20
text: It will be for a sign and for a witness to Yahweh of Armies in the land of Egypt; for they will cry to Yahweh because of oppressors, and he will send them a savior and a defender, and he will deliver them.

name: Isaiah 19:21
text: Yahweh will be known to Egypt, and the Egyptians will know Yahweh in that day. Yes, they will worship with sacrifice and offering, and will vow a vow to Yahweh, and will perform it.

name: Isaiah 19:22
text: Yahweh will strike Egypt, striking and healing. They will return to Yahweh, and he will be entreated by them, and will heal them.

name: Isaiah 19:23
text: In that day there will be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.

name: Isaiah 19:24
text: In that day, Israel will be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;

name: Isaiah 19:25
text: because Yahweh of Armies has blessed them, saying, "Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my inheritance."

name: Isaiah 20:1
text: In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;

name: Isaiah 20:2
text: at that time Yahweh spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, "Go, and loosen the sackcloth from off your waist, and take your shoes from off your feet." He did so, walking naked and barefoot.

name: Isaiah 20:3
text: Yahweh said, "As my servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years for a sign and a wonder concerning Egypt and concerning Ethiopia,

name: Isaiah 20:4
text: so the king of Assyria will lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles of Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, and with buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.

name: Isaiah 20:5
text: They will be dismayed and confounded, because of Ethiopia their expectation, and of Egypt their glory.

name: Isaiah 20:6
text: The inhabitants of this coast land will say in that day, "Behold, this is our expectation, where we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria. And we, how will we escape?""

name: Isaiah 21:1
text: The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it comes from the wilderness, from an awesome land.

name: Isaiah 21:2
text: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media"s sighing.

name: Isaiah 21:3
text: Therefore my thighs are filled with anguish. Pains have taken hold on me, like the pains of a woman in labor. I am in so much pain that I can"t hear. I so am dismayed that I can"t see.

name: Isaiah 21:4
text: My heart flutters. Horror has frightened me. The twilight that I desired has been turned into trembling for me.

name: Isaiah 21:5
text: They prepare the table. They set the watch. They eat. They drink. Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!

name: Isaiah 21:6
text: For the Lord said to me, "Go, set a watchman. Let him declare what he sees.

name: Isaiah 21:7
text: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness."

name: Isaiah 21:8
text: He cried like a lion: "Lord, I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime, and every night I stay at my post.

name: Isaiah 21:9
text: Behold, here comes a troop of men, horsemen in pairs." He answered, "Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the engraved images of her gods are broken to the ground.

name: Isaiah 21:10
text: You are my threshing, and the grain of my floor!" That which I have heard from Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, I have declared to you.

name: Isaiah 21:11
text: The burden of Dumah. One calls to me out of Seir, "Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?"

name: Isaiah 21:12
text: The watchman said, "The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire. Come back again."

name: Isaiah 21:13
text: The burden on Arabia. In the forest in Arabia you will lodge, you caravans of Dedanites.

name: Isaiah 21:14
text: They brought water to him who was thirsty. The inhabitants of the land of Tema met the fugitives with their bread.

name: Isaiah 21:15
text: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow, and from the heat of battle.

name: Isaiah 21:16
text: For the Lord said to me, "Within a year, as a worker bound by contract would count it, all the glory of Kedar will fail,

name: Isaiah 21:17
text: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken it."

name: Isaiah 22:1
text: The burden of the valley of vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops?

name: Isaiah 22:2
text: You that are full of shouting, a tumultuous city, a joyous town; your slain are not slain with the sword, neither are they dead in battle.

name: Isaiah 22:3
text: All your rulers fled away together. They were bound by the archers. All who were found by you were bound together. They fled far away.

name: Isaiah 22:4
text: Therefore I said, "Look away from me. I will weep bitterly. Don"t labor to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

name: Isaiah 22:5
text: For it is a day of confusion, and of treading down, and of perplexity, from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, in the valley of vision; a breaking down of the walls, and a crying to the mountains."

name: Isaiah 22:6
text: Elam carried his quiver, with chariots of men and horsemen; and Kir uncovered the shield.

name: Isaiah 22:7
text: It happened that your choicest valleys were full of chariots, and the horsemen set themselves in array at the gate.

name: Isaiah 22:8
text: He took away the covering of Judah; and you looked in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.

name: Isaiah 22:9
text: You saw the breaches of the city of David, that they were many; and you gathered together the waters of the lower pool.

name: Isaiah 22:10
text: You numbered the houses of Jerusalem, and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.

name: Isaiah 22:11
text: You also made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you didn"t look to him who had done this, neither did you have respect for him who purposed it long ago.

name: Isaiah 22:12
text: In that day, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, called to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, and to dressing in sackcloth:

name: Isaiah 22:13
text: and behold, joy and gladness, killing cattle and killing sheep, eating flesh and drinking wine: "Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we will die."

name: Isaiah 22:14
text: Yahweh of Armies revealed himself in my ears, "Surely this iniquity will not be forgiven you until you die," says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies.

name: Isaiah 22:15
text: Thus says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, "Go, get yourself to this treasurer, even to Shebna, who is over the house, and say,

name: Isaiah 22:16
text: "What are you doing here? Who has you here, that you have dug out a tomb here?" Cutting himself out a tomb on high, chiseling a habitation for himself in the rock!"

name: Isaiah 22:17
text: Behold, Yahweh will overcome you and hurl you away violently. Yes, he will grasp you firmly.

name: Isaiah 22:18
text: He will surely wind you around and around, and throw you like a ball into a large country. There you will die, and there the chariots of your glory will be, you shame of your lord"s house.

name: Isaiah 22:19
text: I will thrust you from your office. You will be pulled down from your station.

name: Isaiah 22:20
text: It will happen in that day that I will call my servant Eliakim the son of Hilkiah,

name: Isaiah 22:21
text: and I will clothe him with your robe, and strengthen him with your belt. I will commit your government into his hand; and he will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.

name: Isaiah 22:22
text: I will lay the key of the house of David on his shoulder. He will open, and no one will shut. He will shut, and no one will open.

name: Isaiah 22:23
text: I will fasten him like a nail in a sure place. He will be for a throne of glory to his father"s house.

name: Isaiah 22:24
text: They will hang on him all the glory of his father"s house, the offspring and the issue, every small vessel, from the cups even to all the pitchers.

name: Isaiah 22:25
text: "In that day," says Yahweh of Armies, "the nail that was fastened in a sure place will give way. It will be cut down, and fall. The burden that was on it will be cut off, for Yahweh has spoken it."

name: Isaiah 23:1
text: The burden of Tyre. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in. From the land of Kittim it is revealed to them.

name: Isaiah 23:2
text: Be still, you inhabitants of the coast, you whom the merchants of Sidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

name: Isaiah 23:3
text: On great waters, the seed of the Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue. She was the market of nations.

name: Isaiah 23:4
text: Be ashamed, Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, "I have not travailed, nor brought forth, neither have I nourished young men, nor brought up virgins."

name: Isaiah 23:5
text: When the report comes to Egypt, they will be in anguish at the report of Tyre.

name: Isaiah 23:6
text: Pass over to Tarshish! Wail, you inhabitants of the coast!

name: Isaiah 23:7
text: Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days, whose feet carried her far away to travel?

name: Isaiah 23:8
text: Who has planned this against Tyre, the giver of crowns, whose merchants are princes, whose traffickers are the honorable of the earth?

name: Isaiah 23:9
text: Yahweh of Armies has planned it, to stain the pride of all glory, to bring into contempt all the honorable of the earth.

name: Isaiah 23:10
text: Pass through your land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish. There is no restraint any more.

name: Isaiah 23:11
text: He has stretched out his hand over the sea. He has shaken the kingdoms. Yahweh has ordered the destruction of Canaan"s strongholds.

name: Isaiah 23:12
text: He said, "You shall rejoice no more, you oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon. Arise, pass over to Kittim. Even there you will have no rest."

name: Isaiah 23:13
text: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans. This people was not. The Assyrians founded it for those who dwell in the wilderness. They set up their towers. They overthrew its palaces. They made it a ruin.

name: Isaiah 23:14
text: Howl, you ships of Tarshish, for your stronghold is laid waste!

name: Isaiah 23:15
text: It will come to pass in that day that Tyre will be forgotten seventy years, according to the days of one king. After the end of seventy years it will be to Tyre like in the song of the prostitute.

name: Isaiah 23:16
text: Take a harp; go about the city, you prostitute that has been forgotten. Make sweet melody. Sing many songs, that you may be remembered.

name: Isaiah 23:17
text: It will happen after the end of seventy years that Yahweh will visit Tyre, and she shall return to her wages, and will play the prostitute with all the kingdoms of the world on the surface of the earth.

name: Isaiah 23:18
text: Her merchandise and her wages will be holiness to Yahweh. It will not be treasured nor laid up; for her merchandise will be for those who dwell before Yahweh, to eat sufficiently, and for durable clothing.

name: Isaiah 24:1
text: Behold, Yahweh makes the earth empty, makes it waste, turns it upside down, and scatters its inhabitants.

name: Isaiah 24:2
text: It will be as with the people, so with the priest; as with the servant, so with his master; as with the maid, so with her mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the creditor, so with the debtor; as with the taker of interest, so with the giver of interest.

name: Isaiah 24:3
text: The earth will be utterly emptied and utterly laid waste; for Yahweh has spoken this word.

name: Isaiah 24:4
text: The earth mourns and fades away. The world languishes and fades away. The lofty people of the earth languish.

name: Isaiah 24:5
text: The earth also is polluted under its inhabitants, because they have transgressed the laws, violated the statutes, and broken the everlasting covenant.

name: Isaiah 24:6
text: Therefore the curse has devoured the earth, and those who dwell therein are found guilty. Therefore the inhabitants of the earth are burned, and few men left.

name: Isaiah 24:7
text: The new wine mourns. The vine languishes. All the merry-hearted sigh.

name: Isaiah 24:8
text: The mirth of tambourines ceases. The sound of those who rejoice ends. The joy of the harp ceases.

name: Isaiah 24:9
text: They will not drink wine with a song. Strong drink will be bitter to those who drink it.

name: Isaiah 24:10
text: The confused city is broken down. Every house is shut up, that no man may come in.

name: Isaiah 24:11
text: There is a crying in the streets because of the wine. All joy is darkened. The mirth of the land is gone.

name: Isaiah 24:12
text: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.

name: Isaiah 24:13
text: For it will be so in the midst of the earth among the peoples, as the shaking of an olive tree, as the gleanings when the vintage is done.

name: Isaiah 24:14
text: These shall lift up their voice. They will shout for the majesty of Yahweh. They cry aloud from the sea.

name: Isaiah 24:15
text: Therefore glorify Yahweh in the east, even the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel, in the islands of the sea!

name: Isaiah 24:16
text: From the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs. Glory to the righteous! But I said, "I pine away! I pine away! woe is me!" The treacherous have dealt treacherously. Yes, the treacherous have dealt very treacherously.

name: Isaiah 24:17
text: Fear, the pit, and the snare, are on you who inhabitant the earth.

name: Isaiah 24:18
text: It will happen that he who flees from the noise of the fear will fall into the pit; and he who comes up out of the midst of the pit will be taken in the snare; for the windows on high are opened, and the foundations of the earth tremble.

name: Isaiah 24:19
text: The earth is utterly broken. The earth is torn apart. The earth is shaken violently.

name: Isaiah 24:20
text: The earth will stagger like a drunken man, and will sway back and forth like a hammock. Its disobedience will be heavy on it, and it will fall and not rise again.

name: Isaiah 24:21
text: It shall happen in that day that Yahweh will punish the army of the high ones on high, and the kings of the earth on the earth.

name: Isaiah 24:22
text: They shall be gathered together, as prisoners are gathered in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison; and after many days shall they be visited.

name: Isaiah 24:23
text: Then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed; for Yahweh of Armies will reign on Mount Zion, and in Jerusalem; and before his elders will be glory.

name: Isaiah 25:1
text: Yahweh, you are my God. I will exalt you! I will praise your name, for you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago, in complete faithfulness and truth.

name: Isaiah 25:2
text: For you have made a city into a heap, a fortified city into a ruin, a palace of strangers to be no city. It will never be built.

name: Isaiah 25:3
text: Therefore a strong people will glorify you. A city of awesome nations will fear you.

name: Isaiah 25:4
text: For you have been a stronghold to the poor, a stronghold to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shade from the heat, when the blast of the dreaded ones is like a storm against the wall.

name: Isaiah 25:5
text: As the heat in a dry place will you bring down the noise of strangers; as the heat by the shade of a cloud, the song of the dreaded ones will be brought low.

name: Isaiah 25:6
text: In this mountain, Yahweh of Armies will make all peoples a feast of fat things, a feast of choice wines, of fat things full of marrow, of well refined choice wines.

name: Isaiah 25:7
text: He will destroy in this mountain the surface of the covering that covers all peoples, and the veil that is spread over all nations.

name: Isaiah 25:8
text: He has swallowed up death forever! The Lord Yahweh will wipe away tears from off all faces. He will take the reproach of his people away from off all the earth, for Yahweh has spoken it.

name: Isaiah 25:9
text: It shall be said in that day, "Behold, this is our God! We have waited for him, and he will save us! This is Yahweh! We have waited for him. We will be glad and rejoice in his salvation!"

name: Isaiah 25:10
text: For in this mountain the hand of Yahweh will rest. Moab will be trodden down in his place, even like straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.

name: Isaiah 25:11
text: He will spread out his hands in its midst, like one who swims spreads out hands to swim, but his pride will be humbled together with the craft of his hands.

name: Isaiah 25:12
text: He has brought the high fortress of your walls down, laid low, and brought to the ground, even to the dust.

name: Isaiah 26:1
text: In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: "We have a strong city. God appoints salvation for walls and bulwarks.

name: Isaiah 26:2
text: Open the gates, that the righteous nation may enter: the one which keeps faith.

name: Isaiah 26:3
text: You will keep whoever"s mind is steadfast in perfect peace, because he trusts in you.

name: Isaiah 26:4
text: Trust in Yahweh forever; for in Yah, Yahweh, is an everlasting Rock.

name: Isaiah 26:5
text: For he has brought down those who dwell on high, the lofty city. He lays it low. He lays it low even to the ground. He brings it even to the dust.

name: Isaiah 26:6
text: The foot shall tread it down; Even the feet of the poor, and the steps of the needy."

name: Isaiah 26:7
text: The way of the just is uprightness. You who are upright make the path of the righteous level.

name: Isaiah 26:8
text: Yes, in the way of your judgments, Yahweh, have we waited for you. Your name and your renown are the desire of our soul.

name: Isaiah 26:9
text: With my soul have I desired you in the night. Yes, with my spirit within me will I seek you earnestly; for when your judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

name: Isaiah 26:10
text: Let favor be shown to the wicked, yet he will not learn righteousness. In the land of uprightness he will deal wrongfully, and will not see Yahweh"s majesty.

name: Isaiah 26:11
text: Yahweh, your hand is lifted up, yet they don"t see; but they will see your zeal for the people, and be disappointed. Yes, fire will consume your adversaries.

name: Isaiah 26:12
text: Yahweh, you will ordain peace for us, for you have also worked all our works for us.

name: Isaiah 26:13
text: Yahweh our God, other lords besides you have had dominion over us, but by you only will we make mention of your name.

name: Isaiah 26:14
text: The dead shall not live. The deceased shall not rise. Therefore have you visited and destroyed them, and caused all memory of them to perish.

name: Isaiah 26:15
text: You have increased the nation, O Yahweh. You have increased the nation! You are glorified! You have enlarged all the borders of the land.

name: Isaiah 26:16
text: Yahweh, in trouble they have visited you. They poured out a prayer when your chastening was on them.

name: Isaiah 26:17
text: Like as a woman with child, who draws near the time of her delivery, is in pain and cries out in her pangs; so we have been before you, Yahweh.

name: Isaiah 26:18
text: We have been with child. We have been in pain. We gave birth, it seems, only to wind. We have not worked any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

name: Isaiah 26:19
text: Your dead shall live. My dead bodies shall arise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in the dust; for your dew is like the dew of herbs, and the earth will cast forth the dead.

name: Isaiah 26:20
text: Come, my people, enter into your rooms, and shut your doors behind you. Hide yourself for a little moment, until the indignation is past.

name: Isaiah 26:21
text: For, behold, Yahweh comes forth out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity. The earth also will disclose her blood, and will no longer cover her slain.

name: Isaiah 27:1
text: In that day, Yahweh with his hard and great and strong sword will punish leviathan, the fleeing serpent, and leviathan the twisted serpent; and he will kill the dragon that is in the sea.

name: Isaiah 27:2
text: In that day, sing to her, "A pleasant vineyard!

name: Isaiah 27:3
text: I, Yahweh, am its keeper. I will water it every moment. Lest anyone damage it, I will keep it night and day.

name: Isaiah 27:4
text: Wrath is not in me, but if I should find briers and thorns, I would do battle! I would march on them and I would burn them together.

name: Isaiah 27:5
text: Or else let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peace with me. Let him make peace with me."

name: Isaiah 27:6
text: In days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bud. They will fill the surface of the world with fruit.

name: Isaiah 27:7
text: Has he struck them as he struck those who struck them? Or are they killed like those who killed them were killed?

name: Isaiah 27:8
text: In measure, when you send them away, you contend with them. He has removed them with his rough blast in the day of the east wind.

name: Isaiah 27:9
text: Therefore, by this the iniquity of Jacob will be forgiven, and this is all the fruit of taking away his sin: that he makes all the stones of the altar as chalk stones that are beaten in pieces, so that the Asherim and the incense altars shall rise no more.

name: Isaiah 27:10
text: For the fortified city is solitary, a habitation deserted and forsaken, like the wilderness. The calf will feed there, and there he will lie down, and consume its branches.

name: Isaiah 27:11
text: When its boughs are withered, they will be broken off. The women will come and set them on fire, for they are a people of no understanding. Therefore he who made them will not have compassion on them, and he who formed them will show them no favor.

name: Isaiah 27:12
text: It will happen in that day, that Yahweh will thresh from the flowing stream of the Euphrates to the brook of Egypt; and you will be gathered one by one, children of Israel.

name: Isaiah 27:13
text: It will happen in that day that a great trumpet will be blown; and those who were ready to perish in the land of Assyria, and those who were outcasts in the land of Egypt, shall come; and they will worship Yahweh in the holy mountain at Jerusalem.

name: Isaiah 28:1
text: Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley of those who are overcome with wine!

name: Isaiah 28:2
text: Behold, the Lord has a mighty and strong one. Like a storm of hail, a destroying storm, and like a storm of mighty waters overflowing, he will cast them down to the earth with his hand.

name: Isaiah 28:3
text: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden under foot.

name: Isaiah 28:4
text: The fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley, shall be like the first-ripe fig before the summer; which someone picks and eats as soon as he sees it.

name: Isaiah 28:5
text: In that day, Yahweh of Armies will become a crown of glory, and a diadem of beauty, to the residue of his people;

name: Isaiah 28:6
text: and a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, and strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

name: Isaiah 28:7
text: They also reel with wine, and stagger with strong drink. The priest and the prophet reel with strong drink. They are swallowed up by wine. They stagger with strong drink. They err in vision. They stumble in judgment.

name: Isaiah 28:8
text: For all tables are completely full of filthy vomit and filthiness.

name: Isaiah 28:9
text: Whom will he teach knowledge? To whom will he explain the message? Those who are weaned from the milk, and drawn from the breasts?

name: Isaiah 28:10
text: For it is precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little.

name: Isaiah 28:11
text: But he will speak to this nation with stammering lips and in another language;

name: Isaiah 28:12
text: to whom he said, "This is the resting place. Give rest to weary;" and "This is the refreshing;" yet they would not hear.

name: Isaiah 28:13
text: Therefore the word of Yahweh will be to them precept on precept, precept on precept; line on line, line on line; here a little, there a little; that they may go, fall backward, be broken, be snared, and be taken.

name: Isaiah 28:14
text: Therefore hear the word of Yahweh, you scoffers, that rule this people in Jerusalem:

name: Isaiah 28:15
text: "Because you have said, "We have made a covenant with death, and with Sheol are we in agreement. When the overflowing scourge passes through, it won"t come to us; for we have made lies our refuge, and we have hidden ourselves under falsehood.""

name: Isaiah 28:16
text: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, "Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious cornerstone of a sure foundation. He who believes shall not act hastily.

name: Isaiah 28:17
text: I will make justice the measuring line, and righteousness the plumb line. The hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and the waters will overflow the hiding place.

name: Isaiah 28:18
text: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.

name: Isaiah 28:19
text: As often as it passes through, it will seize you; for morning by morning it will pass through, by day and by night; and it will be nothing but terror to understand the message."

name: Isaiah 28:20
text: For the bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket is too narrow to wrap oneself in.

name: Isaiah 28:21
text: For Yahweh will rise up as on Mount Perazim. He will be angry as in the valley of Gibeon; that he may do his work, his unusual work, and bring to pass his act, his extraordinary act.

name: Isaiah 28:22
text: Now therefore don"t be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, on the whole earth.

name: Isaiah 28:23
text: Give ear, and hear my voice! Listen, and hear my speech!

name: Isaiah 28:24
text: Does he who plows to sow plow continually? Does he keep turning the soil and breaking the clods?

name: Isaiah 28:25
text: When he has leveled its surface, doesn"t he plant the dill, and scatter the cumin seed, and put in the wheat in rows, the barley in the appointed place, and the spelt in its place?

name: Isaiah 28:26
text: For his God instructs him in right judgment, and teaches him.

name: Isaiah 28:27
text: For the dill are not threshed with a sharp instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned over the cumin; but the dill is beaten out with a stick, and the cumin with a rod.

name: Isaiah 28:28
text: Bread flour must be ground; so he will not always be threshing it. Although he drives the wheel of his threshing cart over it, his horses don"t grind it.

name: Isaiah 28:29
text: This also comes forth from Yahweh of Armies, who is wonderful in counsel, and excellent in wisdom.

name: Isaiah 29:1
text: Woe to Ariel! Ariel, the city where David encamped! Add year to year; let the feasts come around;

name: Isaiah 29:2
text: then I will distress Ariel, and there will be mourning and lamentation. She shall be to me as an altar hearth.

name: Isaiah 29:3
text: I will encamp against you all around you, and will lay siege against you with posted troops. I will raise siege works against you.

name: Isaiah 29:4
text: You will be brought down, and will speak out of the ground. Your speech will mumble out of the dust. Your voice will be as of one who has a familiar spirit, out of the ground, and your speech will whisper out of the dust.

name: Isaiah 29:5
text: But the multitude of your foes will be like fine dust, and the multitude of the ruthless ones like chaff that blows away. Yes, it will be in an instant, suddenly.

name: Isaiah 29:6
text: She will be visited by Yahweh of Armies with thunder, with earthquake, with great noise, with whirlwind and storm, and with the flame of a devouring fire.

name: Isaiah 29:7
text: The multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all who fight against her and her stronghold, and who distress her, will be like a dream, a vision of the night.

name: Isaiah 29:8
text: It will be like when a hungry man dreams, and behold, he eats; but he awakes, and his hunger isn"t satisfied; or like when a thirsty man dreams, and behold, he drinks; but he awakes, and behold, he is faint, and he is still thirsty. The multitude of all the nations that fight against Mount Zion will be like that.

name: Isaiah 29:9
text: Pause and wonder! Blind yourselves and be blind! They are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

name: Isaiah 29:10
text: For Yahweh has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep, and has closed your eyes, the prophets; and he has covered your heads, the seers.

name: Isaiah 29:11
text: All vision has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which men deliver to one who is educated, saying, "Read this, please;" and he says, "I can"t, for it is sealed:"

name: Isaiah 29:12
text: and the book is delivered to one who is not educated, saying, "Read this, please;" and he says, "I can"t read."

name: Isaiah 29:13
text: The Lord said, "Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;

name: Isaiah 29:14
text: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden."

name: Isaiah 29:15
text: Woe to those who deeply hide their counsel from Yahweh, and whose works are in the dark, and who say, "Who sees us?" and "Who knows us?"

name: Isaiah 29:16
text: You turn things upside down! Should the potter be thought to be like clay; that the thing made should say about him who made it, "He didn"t make me;" or the thing formed say of him who formed it, "He has no understanding?"

name: Isaiah 29:17
text: Isn"t it yet a very little while, and Lebanon will be turned into a fruitful field, and the fruitful field will be regarded as a forest?

name: Isaiah 29:18
text: In that day, the deaf will hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind will see out of obscurity and out of darkness.

name: Isaiah 29:19
text: The humble also will increase their joy in Yahweh, and the poor among men will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

name: Isaiah 29:20
text: For the ruthless is brought to nothing, and the scoffer ceases, and all those who are alert to do evil are cut off"

name: Isaiah 29:21
text: who cause a person to be indicted by a word, and lay a snare for the arbiter in the gate, and who deprive the innocent of justice with false testimony.

name: Isaiah 29:22
text: Therefore thus says Yahweh, who redeemed Abraham, concerning the house of Jacob: "Jacob shall no longer be ashamed, neither shall his face grow pale.

name: Isaiah 29:23
text: But when he sees his children, the work of my hands, in the midst of him, they will sanctify my name. Yes, they will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.

name: Isaiah 29:24
text: They also who err in spirit will come to understanding, and those who grumble will receive instruction."

name: Isaiah 30:1
text: "Woe to the rebellious children," says Yahweh, "who take counsel, but not from me; and who make an alliance, but not with my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin,

name: Isaiah 30:2
text: who set out to go down into Egypt, and have not asked my advice; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt!

name: Isaiah 30:3
text: Therefore the strength of Pharaoh will be your shame, and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt your confusion.

name: Isaiah 30:4
text: For their princes are at Zoan, and their ambassadors have come to Hanes.

name: Isaiah 30:5
text: They shall all be ashamed because of a people that can"t profit them, that are not a help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach."

name: Isaiah 30:6
text: The burden of the animals of the South. Through the land of trouble and anguish, of the lioness and the lion, the viper and fiery flying serpent, they carry their riches on the shoulders of young donkeys, and their treasures on the humps of camels, to an unprofitable people.

name: Isaiah 30:7
text: For Egypt helps in vain, and to no purpose; therefore have I called her Rahab who sits still.

name: Isaiah 30:8
text: Now go, write it before them on a tablet, and inscribe it in a book, that it may be for the time to come forever and ever.

name: Isaiah 30:9
text: For it is a rebellious people, lying children, children who will not hear the law of Yahweh;

name: Isaiah 30:10
text: who tell the seers, "Don"t see!" and to the prophets, "Don"t prophesy to us right things. Tell us pleasant things. Prophesy deceits.

name: Isaiah 30:11
text: Get out of the way. Turn aside from the path. Cause the Holy One of Israel to cease from before us."

name: Isaiah 30:12
text: Therefore thus says the Holy One of Israel, "Because you despise this word, and trust in oppression and perverseness, and rely on it;

name: Isaiah 30:13
text: therefore this iniquity shall be to you like a breach ready to fall, swelling out in a high wall, whose breaking comes suddenly in an instant.

name: Isaiah 30:14
text: He will break it as a potter"s vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing, so that there won"t be found among the broken piece a piece good enough to take fire from the hearth, or to dip up water out of the cistern."

name: Isaiah 30:15
text: For thus said the Lord Yahweh, the Holy One of Israel, "You will be saved in returning and rest. Your strength will be in quietness and in confidence." You refused,

name: Isaiah 30:16
text: but you said, "No, for we will flee on horses;" therefore you will flee; and, "We will ride on the swift;" therefore those who pursue you will be swift.

name: Isaiah 30:17
text: One thousand will flee at the threat of one. At the threat of five, you will flee until you are left like a beacon on the top of a mountain, and like a banner on a hill.

name: Isaiah 30:18
text: Therefore Yahweh will wait, that he may be gracious to you; and therefore he will be exalted, that he may have mercy on you, for Yahweh is a God of justice. Blessed are all those who wait for him.

name: Isaiah 30:19
text: For the people will dwell in Zion at Jerusalem. You will weep no more. He will surely be gracious to you at the voice of your cry. When he hears you, he will answer you.

name: Isaiah 30:20
text: Though the Lord may give you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, yet your teachers won"t be hidden anymore, but your eyes will see your teachers;

name: Isaiah 30:21
text: and when you turn to the right hand, and when you turn to the left, your ears will hear a voice behind you, saying, "This is the way. Walk in it."

name: Isaiah 30:22
text: You shall defile the overlaying of your engraved images of silver, and the plating of your molten images of gold. You shall cast them away as an unclean thing. You shall tell it, "Go away!"

name: Isaiah 30:23
text: He will give the rain for your seed, with which you will sow the ground; and bread of the increase of the ground will be rich and plentiful. In that day, your livestock will feed in large pastures.

name: Isaiah 30:24
text: The oxen likewise and the young donkeys that till the ground will eat savory provender, which has been winnowed with the shovel and with the fork.

name: Isaiah 30:25
text: There shall be brooks and streams of water on every lofty mountain and on every high hill in the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.

name: Isaiah 30:26
text: Moreover the light of the moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven days, in the day that Yahweh binds up the fracture of his people, and heals the wound they were struck with.

name: Isaiah 30:27
text: Behold, the name of Yahweh comes from far away, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke. His lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire.

name: Isaiah 30:28
text: His breath is as an overflowing stream that reaches even to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction; and a bridle that leads to ruin will be in the jaws of the peoples.

name: Isaiah 30:29
text: You will have a song, as in the night when a holy feast is kept; and gladness of heart, as when one goes with a flute to come to Yahweh"s mountain, to Israel"s Rock.

name: Isaiah 30:30
text: Yahweh will cause his glorious voice to be heard, and will show the descent of his arm, with the indignation of his anger, and the flame of a devouring fire, with a blast, storm, and hailstones.

name: Isaiah 30:31
text: For through the voice of Yahweh the Assyrian will be dismayed. He will strike him with his rod.

name: Isaiah 30:32
text: Every stroke of the rod of punishment, which Yahweh will lay on him, will be with the sound of tambourines and harps. He will fight with them in battles, brandishing weapons.

name: Isaiah 30:33
text: For his burning place has long been ready. Yes, for the king it is prepared. He has made its pyre deep and large with fire and much wood. Yahweh"s breath, like a stream of sulfur, kindles it.

name: Isaiah 31:1
text: Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help, and rely on horses, and trust in chariots because they are many, and in horsemen because they are very strong, but they don"t look to the Holy One of Israel, and they don"t seek Yahweh!

name: Isaiah 31:2
text: Yet he also is wise, and will bring disaster, and will not call back his words, but will arise against the house of the evildoers, and against the help of those who work iniquity.

name: Isaiah 31:3
text: Now the Egyptians are men, and not God; and their horses flesh, and not spirit. When Yahweh stretches out his hand, both he who helps shall stumble, and he who is helped shall fall, and they all shall be consumed together.

name: Isaiah 31:4
text: For thus says Yahweh to me, "As the lion and the young lion growling over his prey, if a multitude of shepherds is called together against him, will not be dismayed at their voice, nor abase himself for their noise, so Yahweh of Armies will come down to fight on Mount Zion and on its heights.

name: Isaiah 31:5
text: As birds hovering, so Yahweh of Armies will protect Jerusalem. He will protect and deliver it. He will pass over and preserve it."

name: Isaiah 31:6
text: Return to him from whom you have deeply revolted, children of Israel.

name: Isaiah 31:7
text: For in that day everyone shall cast away his idols of silver and his idols of gold"sin which your own hands have made for you.

name: Isaiah 31:8
text: "The Assyrian will fall by the sword, not of man; and the sword, not of mankind, shall devour him. He will flee from the sword, and his young men will become subject to forced labor.

name: Isaiah 31:9
text: His rock will pass away by reason of terror, and his princes will be afraid of the banner," says Yahweh, whose fire is in Zion, and his furnace in Jerusalem.

name: Isaiah 32:1
text: Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in justice.

name: Isaiah 32:2
text: A man shall be as a hiding place from the wind, and a covert from the storm, as streams of water in a dry place, as the shade of a large rock in a weary land.

name: Isaiah 32:3
text: The eyes of those who see will not be dim, and the ears of those who hear will listen.

name: Isaiah 32:4
text: The heart of the rash will understand knowledge, and the tongue of the stammerers will be ready to speak plainly.

name: Isaiah 32:5
text: The fool will no longer be called noble, nor the scoundrel be highly respected.

name: Isaiah 32:6
text: For the fool will speak folly, and his heart will work iniquity, to practice profanity, and to utter error against Yahweh, To make empty the soul of the hungry, and to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

name: Isaiah 32:7
text: The ways of the scoundrel are evil. He devises wicked devices to destroy the humble with lying words, even when the needy speaks right.

name: Isaiah 32:8
text: But the noble devises noble things; and he will continue in noble things.

name: Isaiah 32:9
text: Rise up, you women who are at ease! Hear my voice! You careless daughters, give ear to my speech!

name: Isaiah 32:10
text: For days beyond a year you will be troubled, you careless women; for the vintage shall fail. The harvest won"t come.

name: Isaiah 32:11
text: Tremble, you women who are at ease! Be troubled, you careless ones! Strip yourselves, make yourselves naked, and put sackcloth on your waist.

name: Isaiah 32:12
text: Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine.

name: Isaiah 32:13
text: Thorns and briars will come up on my people"s land; yes, on all the houses of joy in the joyous city.

name: Isaiah 32:14
text: For the palace will be forsaken. The populous city will be deserted. The hill and the watchtower will be for dens forever, a delight for wild donkeys, a pasture of flocks;

name: Isaiah 32:15
text: Until the Spirit is poured on us from on high, and the wilderness becomes a fruitful field, and the fruitful field is considered a forest.

name: Isaiah 32:16
text: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness; and righteousness will remain in the fruitful field.

name: Isaiah 32:17
text: The work of righteousness will be peace; and the effect of righteousness, quietness and confidence forever.

name: Isaiah 32:18
text: My people will live in a peaceful habitation, in safe dwellings, and in quiet resting places.

name: Isaiah 32:19
text: Though hail flattens the forest, and the city is leveled completely.

name: Isaiah 32:20
text: Blessed are you who sow beside all waters, who send out the feet of the ox and the donkey.

name: Isaiah 33:1
text: Woe to you who destroy, but you weren"t destroyed; and who betray, but nobody betrayed you! When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed; and when you have made an end of betrayal, you will be betrayed.

name: Isaiah 33:2
text: Yahweh, be gracious to us. We have waited for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation also in the time of trouble.

name: Isaiah 33:3
text: At the noise of the thunder, the peoples have fled. When you lift yourself up, the nations are scattered.

name: Isaiah 33:4
text: Your spoil will be gathered as the caterpillar gathers. Men will leap on it as locusts leap.

name: Isaiah 33:5
text: Yahweh is exalted, for he dwells on high. He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

name: Isaiah 33:6
text: There will be stability in your times, abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge. The fear of Yahweh is your treasure.

name: Isaiah 33:7
text: Behold, their valiant ones cry outside; the ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.

name: Isaiah 33:8
text: The highways are desolate. The traveling man ceases. The covenant is broken. He has despised the cities. He doesn"t respect man.

name: Isaiah 33:9
text: The land mourns and languishes. Lebanon is confounded and withers away. Sharon is like a desert, and Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

name: Isaiah 33:10
text: "Now I will arise," says Yahweh; "Now I will lift myself up. Now I will be exalted.

name: Isaiah 33:11
text: You will conceive chaff. You will bring forth stubble. Your breath is a fire that will devour you.

name: Isaiah 33:12
text: The peoples will be like the burning of lime, like thorns that are cut down and burned in the fire.

name: Isaiah 33:13
text: Hear, you who are far off, what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my might."

name: Isaiah 33:14
text: The sinners in Zion are afraid. Trembling has seized the godless ones. Who among us can live with the devouring fire? Who among us can live with everlasting burning?

name: Isaiah 33:15
text: He who walks righteously, and speaks blamelessly; He who despises the gain of oppressions, who gestures with his hands, refusing to take a bribe, who stops his ears from hearing of blood, and shuts his eyes from looking at evil"

name: Isaiah 33:16
text: he will dwell on high. His place of defense will be the fortress of rocks. His bread will be supplied. His waters will be sure.

name: Isaiah 33:17
text: Your eyes will see the king in his beauty. They will see a distant land.

name: Isaiah 33:18
text: Your heart will meditate on the terror. Where is he who counted? Where is he who weighed? Where is he who counted the towers?

name: Isaiah 33:19
text: You will no longer see the fierce people, a people of a deep speech that you can"t comprehend, with a strange language that you can"t understand.

name: Isaiah 33:20
text: Look at Zion, the city of our appointed festivals. Your eyes will see Jerusalem, a quiet habitation, a tent that won"t be removed. Its stakes will never be plucked up, nor will any of its cords be broken.

name: Isaiah 33:21
text: But there Yahweh will be with us in majesty, a place of broad rivers and streams, in which no galley with oars will go, neither will any gallant ship pass by there.

name: Isaiah 33:22
text: For Yahweh is our judge. Yahweh is our lawgiver. Yahweh is our king. He will save us.

name: Isaiah 33:23
text: Your rigging is untied. They couldn"t strengthen the foot of their mast. They couldn"t spread the sail. Then the prey of a great spoil was divided. The lame took the prey.

name: Isaiah 33:24
text: The inhabitant won"t say, "I am sick." The people who dwell therein will be forgiven their iniquity.

name: Isaiah 34:1
text: Come near, you nations, to hear! Listen, you peoples. Let the earth and all it contains hear; the world, and everything that comes from it.

name: Isaiah 34:2
text: For Yahweh is enraged against all the nations, and angry with all their armies. He has utterly destroyed them. He has given them over for slaughter.

name: Isaiah 34:3
text: Their slain will also be cast out, and the stench of their dead bodies will come up; and the mountains will melt in their blood.

name: Isaiah 34:4
text: All of the army of the sky will be dissolved. The sky will be rolled up like a scroll, and all its armies will fade away, as a leaf fades from off a vine or a fig tree.

name: Isaiah 34:5
text: For my sword has drunk its fill in the sky. Behold, it will come down on Edom, and on the people of my curse, for judgment.

name: Isaiah 34:6
text: Yahweh"s sword is filled with blood. It is covered with fat, with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams; for Yahweh has a sacrifice in Bozrah, And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

name: Isaiah 34:7
text: The wild oxen will come down with them, and the young bulls with the mighty bulls; and their land will be drunken with blood, and their dust made greasy with fat.

name: Isaiah 34:8
text: For Yahweh has a day of vengeance, a year of recompense for the cause of Zion.

name: Isaiah 34:9
text: Its streams will be turned into pitch, its dust into sulfur, And its land will become burning pitch.

name: Isaiah 34:10
text: It won"t be quenched night nor day. Its smoke will go up forever. From generation to generation, it will lie waste. No one will pass through it forever and ever.

name: Isaiah 34:11
text: But the pelican and the porcupine will possess it. The owl and the raven will dwell in it. He will stretch the line of confusion over it, and the plumb line of emptiness.

name: Isaiah 34:12
text: They shall call its nobles to the kingdom, but none shall be there; and all its princes shall be nothing.

name: Isaiah 34:13
text: Thorns will come up in its palaces, nettles and thistles in its fortresses; and it will be a habitation of jackals, a court for ostriches.

name: Isaiah 34:14
text: The wild animals of the desert will meet with the wolves, and the wild goat will cry to his fellow. Yes, the night creature shall settle there, and shall find herself a place of rest.

name: Isaiah 34:15
text: The arrow snake will make her nest there, and lay, hatch, and gather under her shade. Yes, the kites will be gathered there, every one with her mate.

name: Isaiah 34:16
text: Search in the book of Yahweh, and read: not one of these will be missing. none will lack her mate. For my mouth has commanded, and his Spirit has gathered them.

name: Isaiah 34:17
text: He has cast the lot for them, and his hand has divided it to them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever. From generation to generation they will dwell in it.

name: Isaiah 35:1
text: The wilderness and the dry land will be glad. The desert will rejoice and blossom like a rose.

name: Isaiah 35:2
text: It will blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing. Lebanon"s glory Lebanon will be given to it, the excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They will see Yahweh"s glory, the excellence of our God.

name: Isaiah 35:3
text: Strengthen the weak hands, and make firm the feeble knees.

name: Isaiah 35:4
text: Tell those who have a fearful heart, "Be strong. Don"t be afraid. Behold, your God will come with vengeance, God"s retribution. He will come and save you.

name: Isaiah 35:5
text: Then the eyes of the blind will be opened, and the ears of the deaf will be unstopped.

name: Isaiah 35:6
text: Then the lame man will leap like a deer, and the tongue of the mute will sing; for waters will break out in the wilderness, and streams in the desert.

name: Isaiah 35:7
text: The burning sand will become a pool, and the thirsty ground springs of water. Grass with reeds and rushes will be in the habitation of jackals, where they lay.

name: Isaiah 35:8
text: A highway will be there, a road, and it will be called The Holy Way. The unclean shall not pass over it, but it will be for those who walk in the Way. Wicked fools will not go there.

name: Isaiah 35:9
text: No lion will be there, nor will any ravenous animal go up on it. They will not be found there; but the redeemed will walk there.

name: Isaiah 35:10
text: The Yahweh"s ransomed ones will return, and come with singing to Zion; and everlasting joy will be on their heads. They will obtain gladness and joy, and sorrow and sighing will flee away."

name: Isaiah 36:1
text: Now it happened in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, that Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all of the fortified cities of Judah, and captured them.

name: Isaiah 36:2
text: The king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to king Hezekiah with a large army. He stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool in the fuller"s field highway.

name: Isaiah 36:3
text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder came out to him.

name: Isaiah 36:4
text: Rabshakeh said to them, "Now tell Hezekiah, "Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria, "What confidence is this in which you trust?

name: Isaiah 36:5
text: I say that your counsel and strength for the war are only vain words. Now in whom do you trust, that you have rebelled against me?

name: Isaiah 36:6
text: Behold, you trust in the staff of this bruised reed, even in Egypt, which if a man leans on it, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust in him.

name: Isaiah 36:7
text: But if you tell me, "We trust in Yahweh our God," isn"t that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, "You shall worship before this altar?""

name: Isaiah 36:8
text: Now therefore, please make a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to set riders on them.

name: Isaiah 36:9
text: How then can you turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master"s servants, and put your trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

name: Isaiah 36:10
text: Have I come up now without Yahweh against this land to destroy it? Yahweh said to me, "Go up against this land, and destroy it."""

name: Isaiah 36:11
text: Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah said to Rabshakeh, "Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; and don"t speak to us in the Jews" language in the hearing of the people who are on the wall."

name: Isaiah 36:12
text: But Rabshakeh said, "Has my master sent me only to your master and to you, to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, who will eat their own dung and drink their own urine with you?"

name: Isaiah 36:13
text: Then Rabshakeh stood, and called out with a loud voice in the Jews" language, and said, "Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!

name: Isaiah 36:14
text: Thus says the king, "Don"t let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you.

name: Isaiah 36:15
text: Don"t let Hezekiah make you trust in Yahweh, saying, "Yahweh will surely deliver us. This city won"t be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.""

name: Isaiah 36:16
text: Don"t listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria, "Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and each of you eat from his vine, and each one from his fig tree, and each one of you drink the waters of his own cistern;

name: Isaiah 36:17
text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

name: Isaiah 36:18
text: Beware lest Hezekiah persuade you, saying, "Yahweh will deliver us." Have any of the gods of the nations delivered their lands from the hand of the king of Assyria?

name: Isaiah 36:19
text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria from my hand?

name: Isaiah 36:20
text: Who are they among all the gods of these countries that have delivered their country out of my hand, that Yahweh should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?""

name: Isaiah 36:21
text: But they remained silent, and said nothing in reply, for the king"s commandment was, "Don"t answer him."

name: Isaiah 36:22
text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

name: Isaiah 37:1
text: It happened, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Yahweh"s house.

name: Isaiah 37:2
text: He sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.

name: Isaiah 37:3
text: They said to him, "Thus says Hezekiah, "This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and of rejection; for the children have come to the birth, and there is no strength to bring forth.

name: Isaiah 37:4
text: It may be Yahweh your God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master has sent to defy the living God, and will rebuke the words which Yahweh your God has heard. Therefore lift up your prayer for the remnant that is left.""

name: Isaiah 37:5
text: So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

name: Isaiah 37:6
text: Isaiah said to them, "Tell your master, "Thus says Yahweh, "Don"t be afraid of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

name: Isaiah 37:7
text: Behold, I will put a spirit in him and he will hear news, and will return to his own land. I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land."""

name: Isaiah 37:8
text: So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah, for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

name: Isaiah 37:9
text: He heard news concerning Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, "He has come out to fight against you." When he heard it, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,

name: Isaiah 37:10
text: "Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, "Don"t let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, "Jerusalem won"t be given into the hand of the king of Assyria."

name: Isaiah 37:11
text: Behold, you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly. Shall you be delivered?

name: Isaiah 37:12
text: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the children of Eden who were in Telassar?

name: Isaiah 37:13
text: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?""

name: Isaiah 37:14
text: Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it. Then Hezekiah went up to Yahweh"s house, and spread it before Yahweh.

name: Isaiah 37:15
text: Hezekiah prayed to Yahweh, saying,

name: Isaiah 37:16
text: "Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, who is enthroned among the cherubim, you are the God, even you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.

name: Isaiah 37:17
text: Turn your ear, Yahweh, and hear. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and behold. Hear all of the words of Sennacherib, who has sent to defy the living God.

name: Isaiah 37:18
text: Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have destroyed all the countries and their land,

name: Isaiah 37:19
text: and have cast their gods into the fire; for they were no gods, but the work of men"s hands, wood and stone; therefore they have destroyed them.

name: Isaiah 37:20
text: Now therefore, Yahweh our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you are Yahweh, even you only."

name: Isaiah 37:21
text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Because you have prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria,

name: Isaiah 37:22
text: this is the word which Yahweh has spoken concerning him. The virgin daughter of Zion has despised you and ridiculed you. The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at you.

name: Isaiah 37:23
text: Whom have you defied and blasphemed? Against whom have you exalted your voice and lifted up your eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.

name: Isaiah 37:24
text: By your servants, have you defied the Lord, and have said, "With the multitude of my chariots I have come up to the height of the mountains, to the innermost parts of Lebanon. I will cut down its tall cedars and its choice fir trees. I will enter into its farthest height, the forest of its fruitful field.

name: Isaiah 37:25
text: I have dug and drunk water, and with the sole of my feet I will dry up all the rivers of Egypt."

name: Isaiah 37:26
text: Have you not heard how I have done it long ago, and formed it in ancient times? Now I have brought it to pass, that it should be yours to destroy fortified cities, turning them into ruinous heaps.

name: Isaiah 37:27
text: Therefore their inhabitants had little power. They were dismayed and confounded. They were like the grass of the field, and like the green herb, like the grass on the housetops, and like a field before its crop has grown.

name: Isaiah 37:28
text: But I know your sitting down, your going out, your coming in, and your raging against me.

name: Isaiah 37:29
text: Because of your raging against me, and because your arrogance has come up into my ears, therefore will I put my hook in your nose and my bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way by which you came.

name: Isaiah 37:30
text: This shall be the sign to you. You will eat this year that which grows of itself, and in the second year that which springs from the same; and in the third year sow and reap and plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.

name: Isaiah 37:31
text: The remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah will again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

name: Isaiah 37:32
text: For out of Jerusalem a remnant will go forth, and survivors will escape from Mount Zion. The zeal of Yahweh of Armies will perform this."

name: Isaiah 37:33
text: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the king of Assyria, "He will not come to this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither will he come before it with shield, nor cast up a mound against it.

name: Isaiah 37:34
text: By the way that he came, by the same he shall return, and he shall not come to this city," says Yahweh.

name: Isaiah 37:35
text: "For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David"s sake.""

name: Isaiah 37:36
text: The angel of Yahweh went out and struck one hundred and eighty-five thousand men in the camp of the Assyrians. When men arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies.

name: Isaiah 37:37
text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, went away, returned to Nineveh, and stayed there.

name: Isaiah 37:38
text: It happened, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons struck him with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Esar Haddon his son reigned in his place.

name: Isaiah 38:1
text: In those days was Hezekiah sick and near death. Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him, and said to him, "Thus says Yahweh, "Set your house in order, for you will die, and not live.""

name: Isaiah 38:2
text: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to Yahweh,

name: Isaiah 38:3
text: and said, "Remember now, Yahweh, I beg you, how I have walked before you in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in your sight." Hezekiah wept bitterly.

name: Isaiah 38:4
text: Then the word of Yahweh came to Isaiah, saying,

name: Isaiah 38:5
text: "Go, and tell Hezekiah, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of David your father, "I have heard your prayer. I have seen your tears. Behold, I will add fifteen years to your life.

name: Isaiah 38:6
text: I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.

name: Isaiah 38:7
text: This shall be the sign to you from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do this thing that he has spoken.

name: Isaiah 38:8
text: Behold, I will cause the shadow on the sundial, which has gone down on the sundial of Ahaz with the sun, to return backward ten steps. So the sun returned ten steps on the sundial on which it had gone down."""

name: Isaiah 38:9
text: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and had recovered of his sickness.

name: Isaiah 38:10
text: I said, "In the middle of my life I go into the gates of Sheol. I am deprived of the residue of my years."

name: Isaiah 38:11
text: I said, "I won"t see Yah, Yah in the land of the living. I will see man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

name: Isaiah 38:12
text: My dwelling is removed, and is carried away from me like a shepherd"s tent. I have rolled up, like a weaver, my life. He will cut me off from the loom. From day even to night you will make an end of me.

name: Isaiah 38:13
text: I waited patiently until morning. He breaks all my bones like a lion. From day even to night you will make an end of me.

name: Isaiah 38:14
text: I chattered like a swallow or a crane. I moaned like a dove. My eyes weaken looking upward. Lord, I am oppressed. Be my security."

name: Isaiah 38:15
text: What will I say? He has both spoken to me, and himself has done it. I will walk carefully all my years because of the anguish of my soul.

name: Isaiah 38:16
text: Lord, men live by these things; and my spirit finds life in all of them: you restore me, and cause me to live.

name: Isaiah 38:17
text: Behold, for peace I had great anguish, but you have in love for my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption; for you have cast all my sins behind your back.

name: Isaiah 38:18
text: For Sheol can"t praise you. Death can"t celebrate you. Those who go down into the pit can"t hope for your truth.

name: Isaiah 38:19
text: The living, the living, he shall praise you, as I do this day. The father shall make known your truth to the children.

name: Isaiah 38:20
text: Yahweh will save me. Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of Yahweh.

name: Isaiah 38:21
text: Now Isaiah had said, "Let them take a cake of figs, and lay it for a poultice on the boil, and he shall recover."

name: Isaiah 38:22
text: Hezekiah also had said, "What is the sign that I will go up to the house of Yahweh?"

name: Isaiah 39:1
text: At that time, Merodach Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah; for he heard that he had been sick, and had recovered.

name: Isaiah 39:2
text: Hezekiah was pleased with them, and showed them the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, the spices, and the precious oil, and all the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures. There was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah didn"t show them.

name: Isaiah 39:3
text: Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah, and asked him, "What did these men say? Where did they come from to you?" Hezekiah said, "They have come from a country far from me, even from Babylon."

name: Isaiah 39:4
text: Then he asked, "What have they seen in your house?" Hezekiah answered, "They have seen all that is in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them."

name: Isaiah 39:5
text: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Hear the word of Yahweh of Armies:

name: Isaiah 39:6
text: "Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and that which your fathers have stored up until this day, will be carried to Babylon. Nothing will be left," says Yahweh.

name: Isaiah 39:7
text: "They will take away your sons who will issue from you, whom you shall father, and they will be eunuchs in the king of Babylon"s palace.""

name: Isaiah 39:8
text: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "Yahweh"s word which you have spoken is good." He said moreover, "For there will be peace and truth in my days."

name: Isaiah 40:1
text: "Comfort, comfort my people," says your God.

name: Isaiah 40:2
text: "Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of Yahweh"s hand double for all her sins."

name: Isaiah 40:3
text: The voice of one who calls out, "Prepare the way of Yahweh in the wilderness! Make a level highway in the desert for our God.

name: Isaiah 40:4
text: Every valley shall be exalted, and every mountain and hill shall be made low. The uneven shall be made level, and the rough places a plain.

name: Isaiah 40:5
text: The glory of Yahweh shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together; for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken it."

name: Isaiah 40:6
text: The voice of one saying, "Cry!" One said, "What shall I cry?" "All flesh is like grass, and all its glory is like the flower of the field.

name: Isaiah 40:7
text: The grass withers, the flower fades, because Yahweh"s breath blows on it. Surely the people are like grass.

name: Isaiah 40:8
text: The grass withers, the flower fades; but the word of our God stands forever."

name: Isaiah 40:9
text: You who tell good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who tell good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength. Lift it up. Don"t be afraid. Say to the cities of Judah, "Behold, your God!"

name: Isaiah 40:10
text: Behold, the Lord Yahweh will come as a mighty one, and his arm will rule for him. Behold, his reward is with him, and his recompense before him.

name: Isaiah 40:11
text: He will feed his flock like a shepherd. He will gather the lambs in his arm, and carry them in his bosom. He will gently lead those who have their young.

name: Isaiah 40:12
text: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and marked off the sky with his span, and calculated the dust of the earth in a measure, and weighed the mountains in scales, and the hills in a balance?

name: Isaiah 40:13
text: Who has directed the Spirit of Yahweh, or has taught him as his counselor?

name: Isaiah 40:14
text: Who did he take counsel with, and who instructed him, and taught him in the path of justice, and taught him knowledge, and showed him the way of understanding?

name: Isaiah 40:15
text: Behold, the nations are like a drop in a bucket, and are regarded as a speck of dust on a balance. Behold, he lifts up the islands like a very little thing.

name: Isaiah 40:16
text: Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor its animals sufficient for a burnt offering.

name: Isaiah 40:17
text: All the nations are like nothing before him. They are regarded by him as less than nothing, and vanity.

name: Isaiah 40:18
text: To whom then will you liken God? Or what likeness will you compare to him?

name: Isaiah 40:19
text: A workman has cast an image, and the goldsmith overlays it with gold, and casts silver chains for it.

name: Isaiah 40:20
text: He who is too impoverished for such an offering chooses a tree that will not rot. He seeks a skillful workman to set up an engraved image for him that will not be moved.

name: Isaiah 40:21
text: Haven"t you known? Haven"t you heard, yet? Haven"t you been told from the beginning? Haven"t you understood from the foundations of the earth?

name: Isaiah 40:22
text: It is he who sits above the circle of the earth, and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers; who stretches out the heavens like a curtain, and spreads them out like a tent to dwell in;

name: Isaiah 40:23
text: who brings princes to nothing; who makes the judges of the earth like meaningless.

name: Isaiah 40:24
text: They are planted scarcely. They are sown scarcely. Their stock has scarcely taken root in the ground. He merely blows on them, and they wither, and the whirlwind takes them away as stubble.

name: Isaiah 40:25
text: "To whom then will you liken me? Who is my equal?" says the Holy One.

name: Isaiah 40:26
text: Lift up your eyes on high, and see who has created these, who brings out their army by number. He calls them all by name. by the greatness of his might, and because he is strong in power, Not one is lacking.

name: Isaiah 40:27
text: Why do you say, Jacob, and speak, Israel, "My way is hidden from Yahweh, and the justice due me is disregarded by my God?"

name: Isaiah 40:28
text: Haven"t you known? Haven"t you heard? The everlasting God, Yahweh, The Creator of the ends of the earth, doesn"t faint. He isn"t weary. His understanding is unsearchable.

name: Isaiah 40:29
text: He gives power to the weak. He increases the strength of him who has no might.

name: Isaiah 40:30
text: Even the youths faint and get weary, and the young men utterly fall;

name: Isaiah 40:31
text: But those who wait for Yahweh will renew their strength. They will mount up with wings like eagles. They will run, and not be weary. They will walk, and not faint.

name: Isaiah 41:1
text: "Keep silent before me, islands, and let the peoples renew their strength. Let them come near, then let them speak. Let"s meet together for judgment.

name: Isaiah 41:2
text: Who has raised up one from the east? Who called him to his foot in righteousness? He hands over nations to him, and makes him rule over kings. He gives them like the dust to his sword, like the driven stubble to his bow.

name: Isaiah 41:3
text: He pursues them, and passes by safely, Even by a way that he had not gone with his feet.

name: Isaiah 41:4
text: Who has worked and done it, calling the generations from the beginning? I, Yahweh, the first, and with the last, I am he."

name: Isaiah 41:5
text: The islands have seen, and fear. The ends of the earth tremble. They approach, and come.

name: Isaiah 41:6
text: Everyone helps his neighbor. They say to their brothers, "Be strong!"

name: Isaiah 41:7
text: So the carpenter encourages the goldsmith. He who smoothes with the hammer encourages him who strikes the anvil, saying of the soldering, "It is good;" and he fastens it with nails, that it might not totter.

name: Isaiah 41:8
text: "But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend,

name: Isaiah 41:9
text: You whom I have taken hold of from the ends of the earth, and called from its corners, and said to you, "You are my servant, I have chosen you and not cast you away;"

name: Isaiah 41:10
text: Don"t you be afraid, for I am with you. Don"t be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you. Yes, I will help you. Yes, I will uphold you with the right hand of my righteousness.

name: Isaiah 41:11
text: Behold, all those who are incensed against you will be disappointed and confounded. Those who strive with you will be like nothing, and shall perish.

name: Isaiah 41:12
text: You will seek them, and won"t find them, even those who contend with you. Those who war against you will be as nothing, as a non-existent thing.

name: Isaiah 41:13
text: For I, Yahweh your God, will hold your right hand, saying to you, "Don"t be afraid. I will help you."

name: Isaiah 41:14
text: Don"t be afraid, you worm Jacob, and you men of Israel. I will help you," says Yahweh, "and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.

name: Isaiah 41:15
text: Behold, I have made you into a new sharp threshing instrument with teeth. You will thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and will make the hills like chaff.

name: Isaiah 41:16
text: You will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away, and the whirlwind will scatter them. You will rejoice in Yahweh. You will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

name: Isaiah 41:17
text: The poor and needy seek water, and there is none. Their tongue fails for thirst. I, Yahweh, will answer them. I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

name: Isaiah 41:18
text: I will open rivers on the bare heights, and springs in the midst of the valleys. I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.

name: Isaiah 41:19
text: I will put cedar, acacia, myrtle, and oil trees in the wilderness. I will set fir trees, pine, and box trees together in the desert;

name: Isaiah 41:20
text: that they may see, know, consider, and understand together, that the hand of Yahweh has done this, and the Holy One of Israel has created it.

name: Isaiah 41:21
text: Produce your cause," says Yahweh. "Bring forth your strong reasons," says the King of Jacob.

name: Isaiah 41:22
text: "Let them announce, and declare to us what shall happen. Declare the former things, what they are, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or show us things to come.

name: Isaiah 41:23
text: Declare the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that you are gods. Yes, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and see it together.

name: Isaiah 41:24
text: Behold, you are of nothing, and your work is of nothing. He who chooses you is an abomination.

name: Isaiah 41:25
text: "I have raised up one from the north, and he has come; from the rising of the sun, one who calls on my name; and he shall come on rulers as on mortar, and as the potter treads clay.

name: Isaiah 41:26
text: Who has declared it from the beginning, that we may know? And before, that we may say, "He is right?" Surely, there is no one who declares. Surely, there is no one who shows. Surely, there is no one who hears your words.

name: Isaiah 41:27
text: I am the first to say to Zion, "Behold, look at them;" and I will give one who brings good news to Jerusalem.

name: Isaiah 41:28
text: When I look, there is no man; even among them there is no counselor who, when I ask of them, can answer a word.

name: Isaiah 41:29
text: Behold, all of them, their works are vanity and nothing. Their molten images are wind and confusion.

name: Isaiah 42:1
text: "Behold, my servant, whom I uphold; my chosen, in whom my soul delights"I have put my Spirit on him. He will bring justice to the nations.

name: Isaiah 42:2
text: He will not shout, nor raise his voice, nor cause it to be heard in the street.

name: Isaiah 42:3
text: He won"t break a bruised reed. He won"t quench a dimly burning wick. He will faithfully bring justice.

name: Isaiah 42:4
text: He will not fail nor be discouraged, until he has set justice in the earth, and the islands will wait for his law."

name: Isaiah 42:5
text: Thus says God Yahweh, he who created the heavens and stretched them out, he who spread out the earth and that which comes out of it, he who gives breath to its people and spirit to those who walk in it.

name: Isaiah 42:6
text: "I, Yahweh, have called you in righteousness, and will hold your hand, and will keep you, and make you a covenant for the people, as a light for the nations;

name: Isaiah 42:7
text: to open the blind eyes, to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon, and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.

name: Isaiah 42:8
text: "I am Yahweh. That is my name. I will not give my glory to another, nor my praise to engraved images.

name: Isaiah 42:9
text: Behold, the former things have happened, and I declare new things. I tell you about them before they come up."

name: Isaiah 42:10
text: Sing to Yahweh a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that is therein, the islands and their inhabitants.

name: Isaiah 42:11
text: Let the wilderness and its cities raise their voices, with the villages that Kedar inhabits. Let the inhabitants of Sela sing. Let them shout from the top of the mountains!

name: Isaiah 42:12
text: Let them give glory to Yahweh, and declare his praise in the islands.

name: Isaiah 42:13
text: Yahweh will go out like a mighty man. He will stir up zeal like a man of war. He will raise a war cry. Yes, he will shout aloud. He will triumph over his enemies.

name: Isaiah 42:14
text: "I have been silent a long time. I have been quiet and restrained myself. Now I will cry out like a travailing woman. I will both gasp and pant.
